JOSE MOURINHO, INTER HISTORY IN THAT HUG



MILAN – "I'm no mug,” replied Jose Mourinho in response to a probing question in his first press conference as Inter coach. Sparking roars of laughter.

The comic effect is of course lost in translation, but when you consider that Mourinho was speaking articulate Italian having only just set foot in the country, that he'd chosen a mildly offensive Milanese dialectal term (pirla), that he'd accompanied it with a theatrical pause, a pout of the lips and a wry delivery, it's not hard to understand why he was an instant success at Inter.

Mourinho was like a breath of fresh air. Something different to what Italy was used to. Truly unique.

That first news conference would be the first of countless memorable meetings with the media, in which he coined new terms, offered profound reasoning and inspired hundreds and hundreds of newspaper headlines.

Together with the phenomenal results he achieved on the pitch, it would not be an exaggeration to say the Portuguese redefined the art of coaching. Or at least, the art of being a coach in the media-oriented 21st century.

Utter the word 'Mourinho' to any Inter fan and you press the play button on a personal archive of unforgettable images, running from that initial news conference through to Inter's treble triumph and his goodbye, which of course coincided with the happiest day in recent Nerazzurri history, the 2019/10 Champions League trophy.

One of the most striking images in anyone's highlights reel is that tearful hug he shared with Marco Materazzi – another one who, like Mourinho, has never taken defeat lightly.

Son of a humble coach who didn't enjoy the best of luck – and under whom he played during his time at Rio Ave Futebol Clube – Mourinho has always placed psychology and innovation at the centre of his coaching philosophy. He knows exactly how to turn situations around to the way he wants them, providing the listener with the soundbite he wants them to hear.

"We could only have lost this derby if we'd been reduced to six men – with seven we'd still have won it.” Another of his famous lines, produced on 24 January 2010 after a Milan derby prepared to perfection and utterly dominated, despite played most of it with ten men – and the final minutes with nine.

It was the best way to reiterate Inter's supremacy in Serie A and to celebrate his birthday, which came 48 hours after those goals by Diego Milito and Goran Pandev.

Now into his fifties, Mourinho is aware of what he has given the game. And how much he has received from it too – especially from the black-and-blue side of Milan.

Two league titles sprinkled with an array of records, a Coppa Italia crown and, of course, that Champions League triumph which realised the dream of millions of fans besides the Moratti family. None more so than Massimo, who thus followed in the footsteps of his father, who back in the day had been flanked by another emblematic leader in Helenio Herrera.

History does indeed repeat itself and Mourinho was the man to make it happen at Inter. A man who enjoys a dramatic pause before making his mark. And who cares if the pause had been 50 years in coming.

Who cares if those tears he shed on the day of the final revealed another, softer side of his personality. It only served to make him all the more human. All the more Interista – which, by his own admission, he remains to this day.

Happy birthday Jose, 54 today.

Stefano Pioli was “pleasantly surprised” by the atmosphere at Inter and working with Suning. “I am in the ideal conditions to work.”

The Coach was drafted in after Frank de Boer’s dismissal just 84 days into the job, as Roberto Mancini had walked away two weeks before the season began.

“This was an opportunity that arrived at the right time for me, as I learned from all my experiences,” Pioli told the Corriere dello Sport newspaper.

“Inter is the club I dreamed of since childhood, as my whole family are Interisti. The first Serie A game I saw was Bologna-Inter. I came close as a player, because from Parma it seemed as if I was heading to the Nerazzurri, but instead Juventus came along.

“I was positively surprised by Inter, as the squad was ready to work and aware that the results weren’t in line with their potential. By all working together, focused on quality, precision and details, we can still try to transform this seemingly negative season into a positive one.

“I expected more negatives here, to be honest. Instead I found a club organisation that might not seem united from the outside, but the management is solid and I am in the ideal conditions to work.

“We can build something good for our present and above all the future of Inter.”

There were some suspicions that Chinese owners Suning Group would treat Inter as a toy or another business interest to make money.

“China is a global and economic superpower, so it’s only natural they became a force in football too. There’s a great work ethic, professionalism and precision. I think it can only be good for modern football.

“I see Suning are very determined to invest, support me and work hard. I see people who didn’t come here just to earn money, but to build things properly. They want to invest logically and improve the infrastructure.”

Inter are flying back up the table with six consecutive Serie A victories, eight in all competition, so what can they achieve this season?

“Clearly at this moment our future depends a great deal on ourselves, but we’re not the only ones, as we are chasing teams above us. All we can do is try to win every game.

“I tell my players that from now to May 28 we must try to win as many games as possible and we’ve got the quality to achieve it. On May 28, we’ll see where we are.

“It’s a very tough comeback to complete, but that makes it even more intriguing.”

Pioli真藍黑

to “build an Inter side based on Italians. Players I’d love to have are Domenico Berardi and Federico Bernardeschi.”

The Chinese owners have already invested heavily in the squad, bringing in the likes of Antonio Candreva, Joao Mario, Gabigol and Atalanta’s Roberto Gagliardini.

“I think (Max) Allegri is absolutely right to say a successful team should have a nucleus of Italian players and the proof is in Juventus and Arrigo Sacchi’s Milan,” Pioli told the Corriere dello Sport newspaper.

“In Sacchi’s Milan everyone remembers Ruud Gullit, Marco van Basten and Frank Rijkaard, but they forget that the core of the side was Franco Baresi, Giovanni Galli, Mauro Tassotti, Billy Costacurta, Paolo Maldini, Roberto Donadoni and Alberigo Evani.

“I think Inter are aware of this and Gagliardini’s arrival was part of that approach. There could, and indeed should, be more signings in future going in that direction, building an Inter side based on Italians.

“Clearly there are Italian talents, we are a big club and therefore need to bring in young Italian players. I think that’s an objective for the future choices on the transfer market.”

When asked which Italians he’d like in his Inter squad, Pioli pointed to Sassuolo forward Berardi and Fiorentina trequartista Bernardeschi.

“There are some very interesting young Italian players coming out and Berardi is certainly a talented player, as is Bernardeschi.

“I’d also like to point to Pinamonti. We mustn’t put too much pressure on, as he is really very young and only had one Europa League game, but he’s got great potential, quality and humility. I think he can be an important prospect not just for Inter, but also for Italian football.”

Meanwhile, Inter already invested up to €28m in Atalanta midfielder Gagliardini, who has started every game since his move.

“I believe Gagliardini is a modern midfielder. I like players who are versatile and Gagliardini can play in a two-man midfield or three, has a great sense of position and plays a simple but effective style. That is what I ask of my midfielders.

“The important thing is to cover the ground and have the right timing for runs. He is young and is still completing his game, but gives us energy, physicality and effectiveness.

“Gagliardini was an important investment for Inter.”

Inter have been willing to show their financial power in recent sessions of the transfer market. And for the summer window, Inter have two midfielders from Germany in mind. In addition to Wolfsburg's Ricardo Rodriguez, the nerazzurri are also watching Benjamin Henrichs, a 1997-born left back from Bayer Leverkusen who has already been tapped for inclusion in Germany's national team. For Rodriguez, Inter are not willing to pay the entire €22m exit clause in the player's contract, so they are submitting an offer of €15m+€4m bonus. PSG and other clubs have submitted large bids, but in the favor of Inter is Rodriguez' desire to join the club. As for the pursuit of Henrichs, sporting director Ausilio has been in Germany over recent weeks to scout the player live, and is planning to send a scout on Saturday again. Bayer Leverkusen has been subject to Inter's inquiries, but not an offer from them yet. Finally, for Sampdoria striker Schick there have been positive meetings with Inter. The Czech player, adept at coming off the bench, is being viewed as the ideal backup for Icardi.

After scoring seven goals in twenty matches this season, Patrik Schick has made a name for himself in Serie A. Inter is now interested in signing the twenty year old striker, and they have scheduled a meeting with his agent Pavel Paska who will be at the Ferraris stadium to watch his client play for Sampdoria against Bologna. The nerazzurri are also interested in Shick's teammate Milan Skriniar, they'll continue to monitor the young defender. There are however doubts regarding Luis Muriel, at the moment Inter prefer Schick to the former Udinese striker. Inter sporting director Piero Ausilio isn't wasting time he'll meet with Schick's agent in Milano tomorrow.

Zanetti: ‘Inter want great players’

Javier Zanetti says Inter want “great players, regardless of nationality”, and confirms redevelopment plans for San Siro.

The former defender is now the Nerazzurri’s vice-President, and remained on the board when Suning Group bought the club over the summer.

“Suning is a strong and ambitious group with great respect for the history of Inter,” Zanetti said, in a guest speaking role at the University of Milan.

“They’ve changed the managerial approach, it’s more international and that’s fundamental these days. They are competent people with a strategic plan.

“Suning came to Italy knowing they were coming to a big club and wanting to build something important.

“The philosophy is clear: we’re targeting great players, regardless of nationality. What’s important is to be aware of the shirt you’re wearing and fight for it. What counts is upholding the honour of Inter.

“Then of course it’s good - also with the national team in mind - to focus on young Italians.

“The stadium? We want to restructure the Meazza, that would be the best thing and we’re already well-advanced.

“We also want to build a cutting-edge training ground for the youth system.”

有意大利媒體報導稱，國際米蘭已經和費倫天拿的現任隊長干沙路洛迪古斯就一份為期兩年的合同達成了一致。

現年32歲的干沙路洛迪古斯2012年夏天從維拉利爾轉會到費倫天拿，本賽季至今他代表紫百合出場過25次。

按照費倫天拿當地媒體《民族報》的說法，由於紫百合開出的最新一份報價依然無法讓干沙路洛迪古斯滿意，這位合同將會在今夏到期的防線球星選擇了拒絕。

該報導進一步表示，干沙路洛迪古斯目前已經和國際米蘭談妥了一份為期兩年，同時還會附帶第三年續約選擇權的合同。

中超上海申花主場大火　地鐵站內聞到燒焦味

中超傳統勁旅「上海綠地申花」的主場虹口足球場今晨突然起火，現場火勢猛烈，濃煙滾滾。消防員隨後到場灌救，火勢現已被撲滅，暫時無人受傷。警方透露，事發原因為球場內部攀岩館施工所致。

從網絡流傳的短片所見，現場火勢相當大，路人紛紛圍觀。有網民表示，虹口足球場附近的地鐵站內，亦能聞到燒焦味道，地鐵站兩個入口更一度暫時關閉。申花球迷紛紛擔憂球隊主場比賽將受影響。申花下次主場賽事將是下月16日主場迎戰長春亞泰。

虹口足球場是中國第一個專業足球場，也是上海綠地申花球會的主場。虹口足球場於1998年2月22日動工，翌年2月22日落成，同年3月正式啟用，其總建築面積逾7萬平方米，可容納3.5萬名觀眾。

疑阻伊卡迪入國家隊 盧比斯：「畀人屈！」

【本報訊】日前上演嘅歐聯大戰祖雲對巴塞，除咗祖記大炒巴塞，場邊亦有段小新聞。伊卡迪前隊友兼老襯麥斯盧比斯（Maxi Lopez）喺Instagram上傳咗一張同美斯、馬斯查良鏞及恩尼斯達嘅合照，瞬即被坊間質疑，伊卡迪落選阿根庭國家隊，與盧比斯同美斯等人有密切關係。

事後盧比斯開腔回應，指成件事係由前妻雲達娜拉所策劃，自己相當無辜：「呢單嘢絕對係有人精心安排。」

盧比斯再解釋事件源由：「純粹同啲Friends影返張相，但係就畀人加鹽加醋！大約兩星期前，我前妻Send咗個Message畀我，佢話阿仔想睇祖記對巴塞，咁卒之比我撲到啦，仲安排咗參觀訓練環節同可以見美斯。喺參觀訓練前一個鐘，前妻打比我，鬧我乜都無安排好，所以唔會帶個仔嚟。嘩屌牙！我真係畀佢吹鳩脹！我就去買件波衫畀美斯簽名，再影埋相同條友證明囉！點知張相就揚咗出去，話我搞到伊卡迪無得踢國家隊。至於點解會揚咗？唔關我事！我同美斯、馬斯無見面無傾計成十年啦Ching，我點搞你啊......呢獲嘢完全係有人精心炮製，係局嚟！」

對於老馬對伊卡迪嘅抨擊，盧比斯就表示認同：「馬勒當拿真係講得無錯架，二五仔唔應該入國家隊！」

嘩嘩嘩，如果盧比斯所言屬實，Wanda唔玩政治真係嘥料！兩人分開咁耐，仔都生幾件啦，為咗國家隊席位，又何必繼續消費對方呢？至於事屬真假，永遠都係得佢三個先知！場外花邊新聞，真係獲獲新鮮獲獲甘！

“I didn’t know that Inter scouts were present,” Tielemans told Sky Sport Italia.

“I always try to give my best on the pitch and to prove my quality.”

The man who turns 20 next month was asked if his future could be in Serie A.

“I can’t say yes or no to that. We’ll see at the end of the season.”

Tielemans has been linked with Liverpool, Tottenham and Chelsea, but the favourites appear to be Monaco.

據意大利《都靈體育報》等媒體的消息，國際米蘭準備在今年夏天引進摩納哥鋒線新星麥巴比，他們願意提供7000萬歐元的報價。

《都靈體育報》和《福克斯體育》透露，摩納哥小將麥巴比的出色表現吸引了國際米蘭的密切關注。另一方面，國際米蘭想為伊卡迪尋找一位優秀的搭檔，他們認為麥巴比是非常適合的人選。

《都靈體育報》認為，國際米蘭和摩納哥兩家球會的官員已經開始進行接觸。

2016-17賽季開始至今，年僅18歲的麥巴比已經代表摩納哥出戰34場比賽，打進21球。然而，儘管國際米蘭渴望引進這位歐洲當紅射手，但麥巴比的轉會費至少是7000萬歐元。

該報導指出，國際米蘭擁有者蘇寧集團不會害怕支付這筆轉會費用。去年夏天，他們從士砵亭購買祖奧馬利奧，價值4500萬歐元。巴西新星加比爾從山度士轉投國際米蘭，轉會費為3000萬歐元。
